creator: prahalad_rag@yahoo.com
text:
I downloaded httpd-2.0.50-i686-pc-linux-gnu.tar and I followed the following 
steps to install apache.

1. Untar the file.
2. ./configure
3. make

   I get the following error while running make.

FATAL: can't create .libs/modules.lo: Permission denied
make[1]: *** [modules.lo] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory ......'/httpd-2.0.50'
make: *** [all-recursive] Error 1

   If I run make as root, the command succeeds and then I am able to run make 
install also as root. But this starts apache as root and I want apache to run 
as a regular user. 

Any work around will be greatly appreciated.

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
If you want to download from source, use a tarball, not a binary build:
